definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Some of these remains became saturated with mineral-bearing water and were thus petrified or turned to stone.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些残骸在含矿液体中饱和并发生石质化。

sentences.english: The nucleus might have a small rocky core.
sentences.chinese: 彗核内可能有一个小的石质核心。

sentences.english: The quality of Mountain Pit Stone is bad. Usually it is used as learning carving.
sentences.chinese: 山坑所产巴林石质地较差，多用于初学。

sentences.english: Protection from a stone cold floor . . .
sentences.chinese: 一个在我摔倒于冰冷的石质地板前将我接住的朋友。

sentences.english: The stony endocarp of a drupe, as in a peach or cherry.
sentences.chinese: 核果的石质内果皮，如桃和樱桃。

sentences.english: Stone mortars and pestles used to do the job.
sentences.chinese: 这套工序通常使用石质的研钵及研杵来完成。

sentences.english: Digging also found in his palace in the presence of a red chamber.
sentences.chinese: 物探同时还发现，地宫中有石质墓室的存在。

definition: white marble/a type of white marble used for building and sculpting
